title: Welcome To STATS140XP
text:
Instructor: Jose Toledo Luna
Discussion: Wednesday 2:00pm - 3:00pm  Office Hours: Thursday 9:00am - 10:00am
Both office hours and discussion will be held online through Zoom



Make sure to sign up or download the following software (in order)

LaTeX
Overleaf: Online \(\LaTeX\) editor
R/R Studio
Quarto: An open-source scientific and technical publishing system
CiteDrive: Online reference manager which integrates well with Quarto and Overleaf
Git and Github: Version control


We will get to this towards the end of the quarter

Netlify: Website hosting service (sign up using Github account)






Fundamentals of Data Visualization
A Handbook of Statistical Analyses Using R (3rd Edition)
CHOOSING THE CORRECT STATISTICAL TEST IN SAS, STATA, SPSS AND R













Date
Topic
TLTT Reading




Week 1 (1/8)
First Day business; Team Fundamentals
Chapters 1-8 + The Author’s Preface


Week 2 (1/15)
Holiday; Résumés and CVs
Chapters 9-18


Week 3 (1/22)
A of Consulting; Asking Questions; Guest Speaker with (mini) Analysis
Chapters 19-25


Week 4 (1/29)
Z of Consulting; 7D Assessment
Chapters 26-28 + Afterward + Timeline


Week 5 (2/5)
Review (on Zoom); Midterm 2/7



Week 6 (2/12)
Data For Discussion; Check Your List



Week 7 (2/19)
Holiday; EDA



Week 8 (2/26)
Editing Reports; Posters (on Zoom)



Week 9 (3/4)
Dashboards (recording); Team Check-In



Week 10 (3/11)
Team Presentations (both days - attendance is recorded and graded)

title: Jose Toledo Luna
text:

and Health Sciences (Summer 2022, Fall 2023)

title: Jose Toledo Luna
text:
I am currently a third year Statistics Ph.D. student at University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) working with Hongquan Xu. Prior to joining UCLA, I obtained my BA and MS degrees in Statistics from California State University, Fullerton. You can learn more about me from my CV
I am gratefully funded by the Eugene V. Cota-Robles Fellowship
Email: toledo60@g.ucla.edu
